dialogue: The pattern of sixths continues past 1. Where does seven-sixths belong?

correct_answer.context: Seven-sixths is one tick mark beyond 1 on the sixths number line

success_path_dialogue: Good. Seven-sixths is one interval past 1.

steps.dialogue: Not quite. Count one sixth past 1.
Let's think about this together. Six-sixths equals 1, so seven-sixths is one more sixth past that. Count one interval beyond 1.

Let me walk you through this. We can see the pattern from 0 to 1: one-sixth, two-sixths, three-sixths, and so on up to six-sixths which equals 1. The pattern continues past 1 the same way. Seven-sixths means one more sixth past 1, so we place it at the very next tick mark after 1. That's how we locate fractions greater than 1 - the pattern of sixths keeps going.
